Perceptor:

"No let me explain myself"replied perceptor he tought a second and said "My 
suggestion is swich thier signatures, specialy Nightlight's; if Hydras is 
seeking recapture her again, he will have to find her firts; let me tell me 
how: every cr in Blackfortress or our old base have a record of every bot 
signature that have been inside even in some cases took samples of them... 
do you remember what happened with Dinobot and his double in Beast wars? or 
with Optimus Prime's puppet that MEgatron attemped to use against Autobots? 
something like that could happen again and had happened  in Neo beast 
wars...  Other way to defend themselves would be inserting a stealth program 
that will mask their signatures from every one, just like the device that I 
gave Nightlight to hide for Maximals... and unluky... for Hydras, it had the 
side effect to hide her for Predacons too. This one will work in that way 
but this one would be part of their bodies... not a device and could be used 
at will"

"it would be like we were playing hide and seek "said Elita with a childish 
tone

"a deadly serious one"replied dryly Perceptor"With those two options they 
would be more safer in my point of view"

-----Original Message----- 
From: Super Cyclonus
Sent: Tuesday, October 19, 2010 1:27 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: The Awakening

> <OLD>
>
> "If you want to catch him then the surprice factor is esencial"replie
> Perceptor"And about Nightlight, she STILL is in danger... not only her
> relationship with the his most hatest enemie also for her unusual spark. 
> My
> sugestion is add her a stealth program that let her hide her signature and
> swich her signature too... and do same with the child"

> <OLD>
>
> Tucson nodds. Elita's protection was just as imperative as her mothers.
>
> "You're right Perceptor. But the final decision should be up to Rodimus. 
> Of
> course, if I were Elita's father, I'd agree to it readilly."

<NEW>

Rodimus looked over at Tuscon, not quite sure what to make of that
comment. For one person to say what they would do in another's
situation is almost like to telling them they should do it, and to not
do it is unreasonable. Who is any one to tell a parent how to raise or
protect thier children, especially one who is not a parent?

Putting that thought off for the moment he turned to Perceptor, "What
do you mean this stealth program that would allow her to hide her
signature and even change it?" There was a definite note of concern in
his voice. "It can't be that easy to just switch signatures back and
forth, if it were, wouldn't we would all be doing it?" He frowned
wondering just how Perceptor was going to come up with all of this. He
respected Perceptor as a scientist, but he was also protective of his
daughter.

Meanwhile in the background Legacy watched Perceptor, his single optic
focused on the ex-Predacon, his thoughts are unknown, hidden as they
were behind his cold unmoving faceplate.

(TAG)

Preston
